column5: Ok how does one delete his post comletely? Theres no tab.  dsn
I'm pretty sure you can't.  That's up to the mods.
You can delete your post by hitting the delete button, but you can't delete the thread.

1. post a pic of yourself with a big ole muskie and hold it by the gills 2. Post pics of OOS fish 3. one word "Google maps" 4. start a lighthearted discussion about politics 5. Be a habs fan 6. Post your fav muskie recipe 7. Give instructions on how to catch a pikeski 8. Mention that there are pike at the leslie spit There are others but these will get you started.
Verno... lol... yup just about any of that will do it....
OK, I'll bite, where's the delete button ??.......Jeeez, maybe I really DO need glasses
I think you go to edit then you will find the tools
No delete is not available to us mere members.  Prolly an admin/mod only function.
Correct me if I'm wrong but as a member I think all you can do is edit a post and if you are the one that started the thread you can only edit your text and not your Topic Title.  Whopper

You can edit your topic title too by using the "Full edit' feature rather than Quick Edit. Deleting of posts was removed after some where taking advantage by stirring up crap then deleting the evidence.
people would do that on the internet? Frankly I'm shocked and appalled
Rick The full edit button does not let me change Topic Title on a thread that I started, matbe I broke it  Whopper
